com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class TrueTypeMarkerSymbol

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseSymbol
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseFontSymbol
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.TrueTypeMarkerSymbol
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Symbol
public class TrueTypeMarkerSymbol
extends BaseFontSymbol

This TrueTypeMarkerSymbol draws the character of true type font. Character is a decimal representation of character code in ASCII.

The symbol support also the most of SimpleTextSymbol attributes. The example:

TrueTypeMarkerSymbol ttmSymbol = new TrueTypeMarkerSymbol();
ttmSymbol.setFont( new ArcFont( "ESRI Cartography", java.awt.Font.PLAIN, 12 ) );
ttmSymbol.setCharacter("252");

See Also:
SimpleTextSymbol

Field Detail

ROTATEMETHOD_GEOGRAPHIC

public static final int ROTATEMETHOD_GEOGRAPHIC
This constant defines the rotate method to the "geographic". The "geographic" method means an angle of 0 is north, and angles are calculated clockwise from north.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ROTATEMETHOD_ARITHMETIC

public static final int ROTATEMETHOD_ARITHMETIC
This constant defines the rotate method to the arithmetic. The "arithmetic" means an angle of 0 is east, and angles are calculated counterclockwise from east.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ROTATEMETHOD_MOD_ARITHMETIC

public static final int ROTATEMETHOD_MOD_ARITHMETIC
This constant defines the rotate method to the mod_arithmetic. The "mod_arithmetic" means an angle of 0 is north, and angles are calculated counterclockwise from north.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_ROTATEMETHOD

public static final int DEFAULT_ROTATEMETHOD
This constant defines the default rotatemethod. The default value is mod-arithmetic. // Note: The default direction of this symbol is not compatible with other symbols

See Also:
ROTATEMETHOD_MOD_ARITHMETIC, Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_ANGLE

public static final double DEFAULT_ANGLE
